description: As wearables get smarter and more independent in terms of factors such as connectivity, the smartphone screen may become less significant.
title: Wearable devices to gain popularity with features like panic buttons: Ericsson ConsumerLab report

description: Worldwide smartphone sales are expected to grow 7% in 2016 to reach 1.5 billion units. This is down from 14.4 per cent growth in 2015, the US-based company said.
title: Global smartphone sales to slow, but India growth healthy: Gartner

description: The program includes an awareness module, coupled with hands-on training modules on how to use the Internet, using mobile devices in their local languages.
title: Google, Tata Trusts launch 'Internet Sathi' in West Bengal to empower rural women

description: The study by the research firm IDC puts GOQii and Fitbit at second and third positions with 18.1% and 6.2% market share during the in Q1 2016.
title: Xiaomi pips Samsung, Motorola to become top wearable vendor in India

description: Tim Cook during his recent visit to the country had asked his India team to tap the more than five million iPhone users in the country to crosssell Mac computers.
title: Apple looking to take Mac computers to smaller towns through neighbourhood electronic stores

description: Data traffic per active smartphone is expected to increase five-fold from 1.4 GigaByte (GB) per month in 2015 to 7 GB per month by 2021.
title: 4G LTE networks to reach 45% population coverage by 2021 in India: Ericsson

description: ET had reported in February that IBM’s India business generates close to $3.5 billion in revenue, although the technology services giant reported a slight decline in profits for the year ended March 2015.
title: IBM India realigns traditional technology services business; brings in top executive to oversee

description: The handset maker has started selling its Le 1s smartphone through retail stores located across prime locations in Delhi and Mumbai.
title: China’s LeEco to sell smartphones in offline retail market

description: The rules also mandated BIS authorised imprinting on device, box and the carton from July, which will have to be done on the assembly line.
title: New battery norms issued by BIS may make smartphone makers face delays in launching models

description: The massive growth is expected to be driven by more than 600 million new internet users and combination of factors including increasing mobile access.
title: India will be bright spot in global internet usage stats: Cisco VNI

description: BI platforms segment continued to lead the BI software market in India accounting for $115.6 million in revenues in 2015.
title: Business intelligence revenue in India to reach $214 mn in 2016: Gartner

description: In India, streaming music and watching videos are the most popular forms of entertainment and WhatsApp Messenger is the top mobile app used on smartphones.
title: Mobile data use per person in India to jump fivefold by 2021

description: Seibert will go back to running Twitter's developer product suite Fabric, which he was doing before the promotion in the fall, a report on Re-code.com said.
title: Twitter to replace its consumer product boss Jeff Seibert

description: The company has also set up a new Centre of Excellence (CoE) in Hyderabad as part of its expansion plans in India.
title: Salesforce to add 1,000 jobs, sets up centre in Hyderabad

description: The conversation today is not about Bitcoin though; it is about the underlying technology which powers Bitcoin, called the Blockchain.
title: There's more to Blockchain than just Bitcoin buzz
